website_summaries.verdict: The My Book Studio Edition II makes a decent direct-attached storage solution for those who need to extend a computer's storage space or want a large backup drive. The drive's rather buggy firmware might turn many users away, however.
pros: The My Book Studio Edition II offers up to 6TB of storage, features RAID 0 and RAID 1, and supports USB 2.0, FireWire (400/800), and eSATA connections
The drive is fast and affordable
cons: The My Book Studio Edition II doesn't support USB 3.0 and internal hard drives made by other vendors
It runs hot, seems buggy at times, and doesn't come with an eSATA cable

customer_reviews.title: Go some place else good buy a  A quality item.
customer_reviews.text: The external hard drive that I bought was supposed to be refurbished to a workable condition. however,the inputs are loose when you use them And I can't use the item as I wanted to with my Tivo DVR as an external harddrive. Tivo says that the Western Digital external hard drive that is eSATA should work with its DVR. This company says that it doesn't. They just don't want to accept their piece of Junk back so they call it custom order and say it's eligible for return. I believe they just wanted to get rid of this hard drive because it was already returned once before by somebody else and they just don't want it back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Eiler

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at it's peak, but...
customer_reviews.text: This external drive is massive in size and weight compared to other devices but provides a lot of storage space. Considering that it is now extremely slow compared to newer technology I wouldn't recommend it. The slow USB 2.0 connections may have worked great in it's time but you can certainly find something better nowadays. I give it 4 stars as it worked flawlessly during it's hay-day, but you can certainly find something of smaller size and more power currently.
customer_reviews.author: O. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet, works great
customer_reviews.text: I got my new WD My Book Studio II and connected it to my mac after installing all the software first then rebooting the mac. The my book was showing on the desktop and I formatted the RAID to RAID !, (RAID is RAID 0 by default). I set up my backup parameters which showed 394.7 GB and started the process, which finished in 79 minutes! This thing is faster than my WD Sharespace. Awesome quality and well built, and the color matches my iMac well too. No loss of firewire connection noted, always ready to go. Highly recommend you jump on this item, you will be so happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyinpa

customer_reviews.title: Not well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a visually interesting design. It looks neat sitting on the desk. But they have not paid adequate attention to heat dissipation. The drives run much hotter than they should. This is very aggravating because the problem could have been eliminated so easily with proper design. I bought two of these, because the first one overheated and one of the drives failed. I'm an engineer, with experience designing similar products, so I like to think I know what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: works great on 64bit windows vista
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after reading the reviews from other windows users who did not have much luck with it. When readong reviews, I always take into account theat the reviewer may not be very accurate in the review. I am using this product on a 64bit windows vista machine, I ran a quick format so windows will recornize the drive, took about a minute was all, after that my computer saw it without a problem. I have the drive manager installed, it works great when connected via USB but the drive manager icon dhoes not show up when connected via eSATA, but the drive still works. Over all no problems, its working great.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Working OK except...
customer_reviews.text: Set up for Raid 1 and everything works well on all interfaces. Only issue is that it scares me a little that it goes into lala land once in awhile. I can still access the data, but can't do a proper dismount. Windows will say the drive is in use and it takes shutting down the PC to do a proper dismount. Appears to be a problem with the firmware. Downloaded the latest firmware from WD but not going to try flashing it until I get another 1TB drive to back up this one. See my review of the My Book Studio that I've returned. I'll be looking for options from Seagate or others since all of this.
customer_reviews.author: dwdw3

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I finally ran out of space on my Mac Mini and was looking for a place to store a few years worth of files and home movies etc. I'm running this drive mirrored for safety in that this is one of two places I keep a copy of these files. So far its a nice fast drive using Firewire 800. The raid was easy to set up with the included software and the drivers WD supplies are quite fast. The only thing slightly irritating is it can be a bit slow to spin up when the computer has spun the drives down.
customer_reviews.author: N. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Goes to sleep automatically!!!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a good value, but it doesn't really work for me. The drive goes to sleep after about ten minutes of not being accessed, and then it takes about ten seconds to spin back up. I searched the internet and learned that there is no way to defeat this "feature". I wouldn't recommend this drive for active use - such as video editing. It might work out okay for file archiving or backup, but the constant sleep will drive you nuts. Oddly enough, I have several other smaller WD drives and this is the only one that goes to sleep automatically. Must be a new feature! Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Over four years of reliable service.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this device for over four years. I use it primarily as a backup device, for the first two years or so I used it with the mirroring. Lately I've configured it so that I have 2 TB of space, typically I use it with the USB interface which i've found more stable in terms of resuming from sleep and hibernating. However when the need arises to tranfer data rapidly the eSATA comes in very handy. More than satisfied with this purchase after all these years.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Silent, Cool, Fast, Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: I have been Very happy with my purchase. It runs great on my Macbook pro. I run it in raid 0 as a storage backup for my photography business. It was easy to setup and runs very fast (I run it on FW 800) I have had not had any problems with heat. As it is fanless, it is completely silent. It also looks much better than the flimsy looking single drive versions IMO. A+ for my uses. Edit 2011: Running Great still. Have run plenty of programs and games off of it and no overheating or failures. Will need a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: SkyphotoX

customer_reviews.title: My Book Studio II number two.
customer_reviews.text: OK so besides my play on words. These little bad boys are worth every dime you'll spend. Keep in mind any WD drive can be inserted so later when 2 TB's isn't enough then drop a couple of 2 TB's in or 3's. Really it's like you're getting a dual drive enclosure for free almost and it's USB/eSata/Firewire ready. Mine are eSatas and they are fast! Buy this and only be cautioned that a quick call to WD to register and then have them walk you through a re-format from MAC to Windows is advised.
customer_reviews.author: linnemeyerhere

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: If you need to consolidate your backup drives and are tired of having drives stacked up, this is your best deal. Very easy to work with, and gives tons of space to use for your backup system. The usb 2.0 works fine with it, if you don't have the firewire card. I bought a firewire card for this and it is well worth having it. If for nothing else, this 6TB hard drive has really given me peace of mind. Western Digital still lives up to their quality and more. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. N.

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: It's been several years since I bought this system, and it's still going strong after being active in a basement 24 hours a day. As a professional photographer, I rely on digital storage to back up my work, and this drive in a RAID setup has served me well.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Jones

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance for the right price
customer_reviews.text: This drive allowed me to obviate the other backup procedures I've used in the past for keeping my iTunes library safe. Its enclosure feels flimsy on the outside but is quite solid on the inside with the most notorious feature of keeping the internal drives fresh and the exterior cool to the touch. Regarding noise, the only time I realize it's working is when it starts up after being slept. However, compared to the Maxtor One Touch 4 and the Seagate FreeAgent Desk drives I already owned, the WD is the most silent of all.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, quickly broke down.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, quickly broke down after short period of use. Would never buy any further products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Happily retired guy

customer_reviews.title: Single use product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Everything on it feels very cheap and fragile. I used the product once to backup my laptop. A week later when I tried another backp of my laptop, it was dead. I was unable to read or write to the device. Customer support was horrible. They had no idea how to handle an issue that did not follow their script. Drives are nearly impossible to access. I broke the plastic pull tab while on the phone with support when they wanted me to remove one of the drives. WD is sending me a new unit but I have 0 faith that the product will be able to used as reliable backup.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Mountain of Storage in a Plastic Box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 4TB external drive for the space, the Firewire and ESata connection, and a dropping price. So far the drive has performed with no problems. It was very surprising when the drive arrived, to see that the shiny silver case was not aluminum, but plastic! So many external cases these days have sturdy metal enclosures. I have also noted that Two bare drives of 2TB from Western Digital can now be had from Tiger Direct for less than HALF the cost of this box. So if you can find a BOX for less than $200 you will save money!
customer_reviews.author: CinemaVerità.com

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Great Airport Extreme companion!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I pulled it out of the box, attached it to my MacBook Air, used the Airport Utility, clicked on Hard Drives, configured as RAID 1, unplugged, attached to the Airport Extreme and it was immediately visible to my Macbook and my Windows Desktop as drive Z. I turned on Time Machine, copied my photos and baby videos from both machines, and slept better that night knowing they were redundantly stored and my wife wasn't going to keep asking "why am I getting all these low disk space warnings". I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: B. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these, the oldest one being about 4 years old (that one is actually a 1TB). They are all running flawlessly. One of the hard drives failed during the warranty and WD replaced it for me. didn't lose one bit of data. They are all connected to my media center via a 4 port USB hub feeding video, sound and images. One acts as a DVR. They are really quiet (no fans) and fast. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have Bought Two And Would Buy A Third
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One I've had for nearly two years and the other for about 4 months. They are great drives and very fast. No problems streaming video from them via any of the connections available. I wondered if there were going to be any problems running two of these drives at the same time on the same system. They do run perfectly together. Adding the second one does add about 1-2 minutes to boot up and shutdown time, but other than that they run flawlessly together. I couldn't recommend this drive any higher.
customer_reviews.author: dclk

customer_reviews.title: Solid drive for my iMac media
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to set up as a RAID 1 drive to hold my media library for iTunes. (i.e. it's a mirrored 500GB drive). I'm very satisfied with it's performance. Really only has a slight delay waking up if not used for a little while and then operates almost as well as an internal drive. Especially with the FW800 interface. The size is minimal and the design fairly stylish sitting on my desk. I have a couple AppleTV's connected to my media library and it handles it with no problems. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive in January 2009 and have filled it up. Drive's been good and done its job. File transfers in bulk work, however when I use Nikon software to move and rename photos it freezes up the transfer after a few hundred pictures (2.5 GB or thereabouts). I've taken to moving pix in 1 GB bursts if going through software - it handles regular file transfers just fine. Plan on buying the 6TB version and formatting it for my Windows 7 desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Snowboarder

customer_reviews.title: Died in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in November, a drive failed in January (2 months later). I called support. They were terrible (hard to understand, didn't fix the problem, said I was under limited warranty - after 2 months)! This thing has been a pain since I connected it. It seems to go to sleep and Windows 7 loses the drive letter. The only way to wake it up is to reboot or turn it off and back on! Much more trouble than it is worth!
customer_reviews.author: L. Flanigan

customer_reviews.title: Great External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice hard drive which I use to back up all my PC's files including HD videos. It uploads and downloads rapidly using an eSATA connection. Fortunately, I have not had to use the restore function to test unit's ability to restore a bad internal drive. So I cannot evaluate that particular function. My one complaint centers on the use of eSATA connections which do not allow me to configure RAID. The external hard drive cannot be found in the device manager to allow this configuration. This would probably not be a problem if Firewire or USB connections were used. The good news is that now I have all 4 TBs for storage instead of just 2.
customer_reviews.author: Video Meister

customer_reviews.title: Perfect external hard drive | Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have the hard drive running raid 1 attached to my iMac (via firewire 800) and so far it has been performing perfectly. The drive is being used to house my iTunes media, master photo files, and some work files. So far no issue at all. Playing HD movies off the hard drive is not an issue. I've only owned the drive for a week so I would hope not to run into any issue yet. I'll update this review if my experience goes south in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Price for Quad Interface
customer_reviews.text: Comes pre-configured as RAID 0. I switched to RAID 1, which is a software raid (which in some cases is better than a hardware raid). The Western Digital RAID manager software that creates the raid is not too bulky. Although I hate having to install unneeded third party software it doesn't seem to be a bother on the macintosh power pc. Transfer rates seem to be as expected. If you don't see an update to this review it means the drives haven't failed.
customer_reviews.author: whyzit

customer_reviews.title: A pleasant surprise. :)
customer_reviews.text: Okay - so I read all the bad reviews on this before I bought it, but I couldn't beat the price. I bought it with hesitance... Well, it's been a couple months now and I have to say that I love this! This product works seamlessly with Apple's Time Machine. It's easy to operate and super quiet. Plug it in and forget it.. it's doing all it needs to all on its own. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a hard drive with enough space to backup your life.. or at least a decade... :)
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Zeal

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Exceeds all expectaions
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. Showed up a week ahead. Perfect setup. Had to download latest software from WD's site, but no problems. Already formatted HD RAID-0. Connected via FW800. Started transfer from current setup 1.75TB of Photographs & Multimedia files. Took over night since coming in via USB2.0 from older drives. Once transfer completed, fired up Lightroom & FW 800 is blazingly fast. Life is so much better now having 180K images library to manage and navigated. (eSATA would be perfect but laptop does not support.) If you are looking, then just Go for it. Thank you "DataVision on the Amazon Marketplace"
customer_reviews.author: Tareq Alrashid

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, awful documentation and help desk
customer_reviews.text: The drive works as promised, but the WD software to switch the RAID installs into a system folder instead of the Applications folder (and it installs with a different file name!) as documented. The Help Desk had no clue to this issue, even after four emails. I eventually figured it out on my own. When I suggested they update their docs and help center, they said I could send a message myself. "Do I get the employee discount?" was my response.
customer_reviews.author: Jantze

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive runs quietly as advertised. However, the power button doesn't turn it off completely. As long as the power cord is plugged in, the blue light inside the case can't be turn off. When I shut down my imac, it take at least 5 seconds longer to complete the job. If I eject the drive beforehand then my imac shut down normally. I believe the drive has something to do with it. It has a few flaws but they are all minor. This drive is working great and the firewire 800 is awesome. It transfer data 3X faster than the USB does. The average speed for data transfer on my computer is 2GB/minute.
customer_reviews.author: vu

customer_reviews.title: Despite all of the negative comments, it works great with a Mac
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of negative comments about this device and others claiming mount errors or constant disconnects. I have had none of those issues and this device works great with my Mac Mini and Mountain Lion. I have it connected via Firewire and have had no problems at all with disconnects or unmounting and would buy another one if they still made them. My understanding is that this model has been replaced by the same one with a thunderbolt connector instead of firewire.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: WD My Book Studio II
customer_reviews.text: The external drive was exactly as expected. I installed it in a short period of time. If you are using windows you have to reformat the drive. It's easy to do. It has a little desk icon which tells me it is healthy. UPDATE I hate this drive. It disappears from my computer and today it decided the drivers needed to be updated and windows will not update it.
customer_reviews.author: daiquiri

customer_reviews.title: What junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst external drive. It's EXTREMELY slow, takes for ever just getting a directory to pop up.I originally had it hooked up with eSata but that just quit working, so I switched it to the USB. Guess what? It's about the same. I suspect the bottleneck is in the drive controller and it doesn't matter what interface you use. Don't buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: angel63

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital My Book II 2TB External Drive
customer_reviews.text: The drive is quite and has FW800. However it is slow to access and transfer data as compared with La Cie. It does support Apple Partition Map, but it will not allow to boot. It only boots GUID for Intel Mac's. So the true premise of backup/and boot up disk is unrealized. In-fact I have found that to be true now for over half of Western Digital drives. I would not recommend this drive to anyone that has both PowerPC and Intel Mac's. Not just because of the boot issue, but also the slowness of the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Pusztay III

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, seems reliable
customer_reviews.text: Got this 3 months ago as a backup for my macs. I keep it under the sofa and plug-in ever so often for a backup on the fly. Works great. The firewire is very fast and being able to upgrade disks is a smart feature. Also the cabling that comes with it seems to be high-quality Will it last? time will tell. Super cheap now that apple has discontinued firewire. You can always get an adaptor ("they make such nice adapters")...
customer_reviews.author: futureglue

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for the price and storing my information , music that i use for my iMac. Was told by a friend how great he liked it and would definitely buy another when the need arises. Functions great, quiet running, and can be tucked out of the way. Like how it can be raided and the capacity - great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Storage for my Mac!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a backup specifically for my Mac because I wanted to run parallels and have my old PC run via a "virtual machine". This unit worked perfectly with minimal reading of instructions... and I have also used it to store all of my photos and only have used 3% with my total PC as well! I have PLENTY of room for growth for videos, pictures, etc! I recommend this unit to anyone looking to buy it. Well worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Drive for your DirecTV receiver
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly with my DirecTV DVR Receiver. Follow the directions from the DirecTV website and you will have over 400 hours of recorded HD programming available to you. Very Pleased. DirecTV only had a listing for a 1TB hard drive this is a 2TB hard drive much more then I would ever need but for the same price as a 1TB I didn't want to pass it up. Update December 2013 Unit is still working flawlessly. No problems with this Hard Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Pat New Orleans

customer_reviews.title: does what i need it to do
customer_reviews.text: i use this hard drive with the sata connector and get really good speeds. the drive is easy to use also once get it set up. can be confusing to set up the drive for anyone that doesn't know what they are doing because i bought the drive which is intended for mac, but just reformatted and was able to use for windows. sometimes the drive takes a while to start up because of the built in power saving technology.
customer_reviews.author: devonp207

customer_reviews.title: Does what expected.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal for the money, it is a simple RAID0 or RAID1 external drive. I deployed it using RAID1 for daily backups of some large files and it is performing as I would expect for the price. The only configuration options I found is picking RAID0 or RAID1 and it performs at the speed I would expect a basic hard drive to perform.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price (in May 2011)
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit about 6 months. I am using it in a raid 0 configuration as a backup drive. The computer it attaches to is running Windows 7 Ultimate. I use it 2-3 times a week to backup files and leave it off otherwise. I have only once had any trouble with it and I cannot say for certain that wasn't due to the computer, everything was fine after a reboot. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Myles

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the 2TB versions, and they've been great. This one seems identical, but it's twice the capacity! I was an early adopter, so I feel I overpaid a bit ($499.00), but considering the capacity, it was still a good deal. I almost bought a second when it came down to $430.00 with free shipping. The only question I have about these drives is whether they can be used for remote access when connected to an AirPort Extreme Base Station, or Time Machine. I've heard that you cannot because they power down (there is a "green" drive inside). When I test this for myself, I'll post an update. But so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mister Tango

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic external drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive three weeks ago. It was delivered on time and there was absolutely no issues regarding shipment (as is the usual for shopping with Amazon). Although the drive is supposed to be an Apple-drive it was easily formatted and attached to my Windows Vista Ultimate system via eSATA. Both USB and IEEE1394 is way too slow so eSATA is a very nice option from Western Digital. I've ripped my DVD collection and even though I have more than 200 DVDs on this drive I still have abt. 1TB left of space ;-) I will not hessitate recommending this drive for anyone with the need for massive external storage!
customer_reviews.author: Rolf Jorgen Strand

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my new imac's Time Machine. When the My Book was delivered it was ready to go and pre-formatted properly so all I had to do was plug it in, turn it on and attach it with the included firewire cable to my mac. I was in business and backing up my hard drive within 10 minutes of opening the box. Easy, simple and a wonderful way to feel secure that I have everything backed up and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Omachka

customer_reviews.title: Good But not That Good
customer_reviews.text: hard drive out lasted for about 5 months then i hdd failed and other worked tried setting up a returned with western digital but wanted to charge a replacement fee with i was not satisfied with so i removed from en closer and placed it as an internal drive on my desktop with till to day still works .
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Because the disc was presetup for Apple, it was a little complicated to format for Windows. The directions could have been a lot clearer. Although it has a esata port, I could not find a way to use the esata port and access the full capacity of the disc. Don't know if this is a Windows limitation or disc limitation. Using the latested version of Windows 7 Pro. The WB tech rep did not seem to know much about the problem. I am using it now through the firewire port which works well but is a lot slower.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W Godman

customer_reviews.title: They work great.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several WD external drives, all of them used with Macs. Between work and home, maybe 10-15 now. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Love it as always
customer_reviews.text: I am a WD Book 2HD/Raid book fan. I think more people should buy these as little "servers" at home. I had a drive finally crap out in an older version of the WD 2HD/Raid drives, I pulled it out, added a new drive, it re-mirroed them, good to go. Never lost a thing. BUY ONE OF THESE DRIVES and BACK YOUR CRAP UP. You'll feel good knowing your family pictures, school reports, billing info is all save and sound on these drives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Taggart

customer_reviews.title: I hate buying external drives
customer_reviews.text: If I can figure out why sometimes it shuts down or unmounts from the desktop, I'll up the rating, but in the end, I'm more interested in it actually not failing in the first 18 months. Then I'll feel like I got my $$ worth. Tired of buying new external storage devices.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Worse external drive I've ever owened
customer_reviews.text: I continue to have problems with this drive that neither Apple nor WD can resolve. I already had it replaced once by WD. No matter how I format it, after a few days of use it stops writing. It tells me it can't be repaired and forces me to erase all data and format again. My disc utility can't repair it. It won't tell me why. I do not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: jav2dj

customer_reviews.title: Great speed and a lot of space.
customer_reviews.text: I got this External Hard Drive less than 2 months ago, and it's been great so far. I have a MacBookPro with FW800 and the speed with time machine it's just great. I like the idea that comes with cables that make it compatible with FW800, FW400 6 pins and USB + eSATA option. It's quite and looks very cool next to your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mau Urena A

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: When the drive first arrived it wouldn't turn on but then after a little while it suddenly turned on. Put hundreds of gigs of data on it after configuring it for RAID 1 (mirrored) which was a good thing because the next day it would no longer power on. Not worried about my data since it is mirrored onto both the drives in the case. I just put in an advanced RMA at Western Digital so they are cross shipping me a replacement and stated that it will be a newer model because this model has been discontinued. Will be pulling at least one of the drives in order to retrieve my data when the replacement arrives.
customer_reviews.author: TzTerri

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Using with Intel iMac (Snow Leopard). WD has done a horrible job on this one. This HD slows my computer to a crawl waking it all the time. And it occasionally dismounts for no apparent reason so you have to unplug and replug. It's worth it if you have to spend a few more books and buy a reliable, well-built external HD. Not this one. Live and learn. And if you don't believe me, search "My Book Studio II problem" on the interwebs.
customer_reviews.author: The_Oz

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: My drive is configured as Raid 1 and works as advertised. Though the software is not Snow Leopard certified, if runs fine in that environment. Though not specified in the instructions, you do need to reboot the system to make the Raid software fully functional. Runs very quiet and very cool
customer_reviews.author: D. Redfearn

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solution for my home movie/TV show/music/podcast server and this thing is it. At 4 TB I have yet to run out of space on it and the firewire connection is perfect to keep it moving over my WiFi network.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon E. Parker III

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital My Book Studio II - 6 TB
customer_reviews.text: Product has performed flawlessly. Truly plug-and-play on the Mac. Using the Firewire 800 interface and the speed is great. The best part of this has been the Amazon-Beach Camera experience. I actually ordered two of these units not being sure if I would need one or two. I had a full 45 days to work with the first one and returned the second, unopened, for a full refund. No hassle what-so-ever. The order was filled unbelievably fast and I had the drives in no time after I ordered them. Would not think twice about ordering through Amazon or Beach Camera again.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I have this unit set up in a RAID O configuration and it performs great as a network storage. Since I use it wirelessly, it does not run as fast as when I had it hooked up to my firewire 800, but it is just what I needed for network storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Great Additional Storage Option For MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I needed an external hard drive to use with my MacBook Pro 17". This drive did the trick, along with an eSATA II card for my ExpressCard slot. RAID 1 configuration, 2 partitions (one for Time Machine, other for additional space). Great speeds! I had to remove one star because the drive cannot be formatted using the eSATA interface. I had to use the FireWire 800 connection to configure and partition the drive.
customer_reviews.author: dendog

customer_reviews.title: Not good.....
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this drive. RAID 1 capability, ready to use with a Mac right out of the box. It didn't disappoint....until less than a week of usage and one of the drives failed. I am returning this one and exchanging for a new unit. I know I should probably get another model/brand, but I'll give it one more try.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: A very nice HDD for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: WD did a nice one with this drive. It has everything I needed at a compelling price, although it's not yet the perfect storage solution. Pros: - FireWire 800! - Very easy setup - Nice price for the 2x1GB unit - Amazingly quiet operation - Interesting design. The status light conveys data with style - Works flawlessly with Time Machine Cons: - Large and heavy - Startup time is shy of 15 seconds - A little plasticky feel... Particularly the top/back/bottom holey plate Do recommend it, so far no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Great external disks
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these. I just love them. I keep adding them to keep all my digital media, photos and video, than I generate with my cameras online at all times. They're super. Work horses. No problem at all and I've had them for years now.
customer_reviews.author: MarkusMann

customer_reviews.title: My Book Studio II
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this drive for use as a backup disk on a 27" Imac with a 1 TB hard drive. I connected power to the drive and connected to the computer via the Firewire 800 cable. I did not use any of the Western Digital software provided. The computer immediately recognized the drive. I opened Time Machine, told it to use this drive for my backup drive and it has worked flawlessly ever since. It is very quiet in operation and I have no problem with heating that i had read in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: F. Raasch

customer_reviews.title: very fast externadrive for laptop
customer_reviews.text: Using the eSATA port it is a very fast extternal drive for my laptop. In my studio I am doing video and sound recording. Each file is in gigabytes which takes a long time to move and edit using USB or WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: J. McFarling

customer_reviews.title: unusable because of spontaneous eject issue
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a habit of "ejecting" itself (spontaneous device removal) even when I'm using it. I could be in middle of a data transfer and the drive disappears from the desktop and a dialog box pops up telling me that I have improperly disconnected my device. I have researched how to correct this problem and the solutions do not work for me. I purchased this drive because I had another WD drive (a 1 TB drive) and thought that WD was probably a good manufacturer. Now I'm not so sure. Also, my old WD drive just died, so now I'm left with this flaky one. I view this purchase as a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: The Angler

customer_reviews.title: Great external HD
customer_reviews.text: Great for all your storage needs, can be set to various RAID settings. Works will with home theater systems and HP TV.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Timms

customer_reviews.title: 8 years, no issues - still working like new.
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm going on 8 years with no issues - still works great! It's a bit bulky, but is good looking.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: PERFORMANCE IS OKAY TO GOOD - BUT THIS IS NO G-TECH DRIVE!
customer_reviews.author: nope

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, but expensive compare to other brands
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 5 years ago, at that time it was a wonderful present for my father, he is creating a lot of music files and needed the space. Today there are better drive, but I can say that this product is reliable (5 years) and this is very important.
customer_reviews.author: Efi

customer_reviews.title: Huge amount of storage for the space and price
customer_reviews.text: I produce a TV show where I'll create almost one hundred hours of video over the next 8 months. I'm using this drive to backup my RAIDs that have all of my video on them. These WD My Books are small enough to move around, yet big enough to make it worth while as a back up as well. I'm going to take the back up off site just in case and for that I would say these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Work horse drive for video production at the right price
customer_reviews.text: We use these exclusively with Macs. These drives are reliable, fast, and affordable. 6 TB seems like a lot but for video production, it was just enough room for high volume projects that needed the flexibility of an external enclosure. HD video playback is smooth with Final Cut using the eSATA connection but Firewire 800 works fine too. These drives have worked so well we've used many of them over the last year on a day-to-day basis. The one drawback is they don't always mount right away like the G-Tech drives through the eSATA connection.
customer_reviews.author: Jd Gee

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a film documentary as a transportable copy of the project. The 2 drives inside as a RAID 0, plus the Firewire 800 made for very good data speeds. We liked these enough that we also bought a second pair. I'm just worried for the day that one drive fails.
customer_reviews.author: M. Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great Price! I run it mirrored to backup our imac. Used the Firewire 800 port instead of my old "mybook" 1TB single HDD via USB. Much faster file transfer speeds. I prefer thebare aluminum finish. Matches my Imac perfectly. Almost silent drive.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek1

customer_reviews.title: Works on my Directv HD DVR
customer_reviews.text: Relied on another review that said it worked, but had my doubts since western digital also sells specific dvr expanders, but this was twice the space for a little more money. Had to purchase separate esata cable. Used instructions that came with it (unplug device you are hooking to and then turn on hard drive let start a little and then turn on device and let it reboot)and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Using on Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is made and setup for a Mac. Its price, Speed on eSATA (i don't have usb 3), and the price per TB is the best I could find. This is the second one and the first is still going strong. Only need to re-format as NTFS and windows 7 recognized it fine.
customer_reviews.author: DXH

customer_reviews.title: Thumb Up for Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as back up to my MacPro computer a couple years ago and it has worked out just great. Like both the hardware AND the software.
customer_reviews.author: The REAL Deal

customer_reviews.title: It's a life saver!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that will hold all my photos and music. Yes my computer was freezing up!,cause my c: drive was too full. My Book Studio II took care of that, if you are like me, takes a lot of pictures and keep a lot of music. Well bigger is better with WD My Book Studio II hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: T Mahar

customer_reviews.title: They need to specify OS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have the 2 TB mirror edition hard drive by Western Digital. It works fine on my Vista 64 bit. I looked on here and it says that this one works on Vista, but didn't specify, so I bought it anyway. It doesn't work with my OS so had to return it and have to buy the Mirror Edition one again. They really do need to specify in the detailed info which bit it will work with. Other than that, I know these hard drives work great. Product 5/5 Store Info 1/5
customer_reviews.author: Gary Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Working hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive has stopped functioning twice since I purchased it. According to WD support, I was told to purchase a new Enclosure, and that would fix the problem. I don't understand how buying a case for their case is any of my problem. It is stated that it should function for both Windows and Apple machines, but some techs i have spoken to have told me that it's an Apple based hard drive. Very frustrated with the drive.
customer_reviews.author: V.E.

customer_reviews.title: WD Studio II External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this, relativley inexpensive, yet massive hard drive. For me, (besides being long lasting which still remains to be seen), the most important attribute is data transfer rate. I am very pleased with how fast I can import videos from, or export them to this hd. I really have found no negatives yet. It was easy to set up. I had no problem formatting it for my pc. (It comes formatted for Mac.) Overall I definetly recommend this to anyone needing a lot of hd space.
customer_reviews.author: mstew

customer_reviews.title: dont understand why all the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: A reformat for windows 7, install tbhe provided software and I was up and running. The drive wakes up instantly (some say they have to wait 2-3 minutes). For having a raid setup with 2 TB of storage this easy from a brand I know and trust it was more than worth the money (I was originally looking at a few off brand setups that cost more on frys.com).
customer_reviews.author: pa27

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: this was a great item at a great price. I back up my entire system, including all external drives, via Mac Time Machine, onto this massive 6TB storage device. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: HereInTexas

customer_reviews.title: Backup hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This 4td hard drive has saved me numerous times. I use it with a MAC Notebook Pro, and TimeMachine for automatic backup. I would buy this product from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: good build for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 different exterior drives and this one is well worth its value in comparison to some of my drives that are at three times the cost. Works great on win7 after a quick format. No fan - we will see if heat will be an issue in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: P. S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much just worked from the start. My experience is that is runs very quiet and now I have my entire video collection backed up through Time Machine. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Webduo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Daily backuos, cant go wrong - consider a different software backup then the WD or MS
customer_reviews.author: mikrow

customer_reviews.title: works with windows!
customer_reviews.text: I have this 6TB beast running in RAID 1 connected to Windows 7. Setup was very easy and performance using eSATA is pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: WD has now replace this drive 3 times and it still does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Same problem everyone else is having on macs. It falls asleep and then unmounts itself. Eventually it dies. When you call WD, they just apologize and deny there is a problem with their drives and say they never heard of this problem before. I tell them they heard it twice from me alone. Then they just change the subject. Great... now I have a third drive that will fail and eventually my warranty will run out.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Fast and simple
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive worked right out of the box, is really speedy to transfer files and is completely reliable in use.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleP

customer_reviews.title: So far...Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Fast and user replaceable internals. What else could you want? I have it set up over eSATA standard RAID0 to a Macbook pro for Final Cut. Works great. Haven't been able to speed test yet but I can at least hit 85MB/s. I might stripe later on. Best 2 drive RAID deal out there as long as the circuits don't fry out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Grant

customer_reviews.title: USB 3 would be better.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it should be included.The build quality could be better. Otherwise it is fast and kind of nice to look at. Great for backing up NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Markhus

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice 2TB size! A bit bulky for it's time but get's the job done with the firewire makes the transfers faster as well. Overall satisfied with this product and have no complaints other than the size. Fairly quiet during operation.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin B. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: If you need a quiet, reliable back-up system for one terabyte, set on Raid-1, this is it, It has worked flawlessly since I received it. The set-up was quick and easy and it's compact in design. Easily fits on a small shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Ruggiero

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the 2TB version of this drive, I spent the entire evening trying to get it to work, with no success. My PC would not detect it when I connected it to either a USB or eSATA ports. I tried connecting it to another PC with the same results. I returned it, then went to my local WalMart and bought a 2TB Seagate drive. My PC immediately detected it, installed the drivers, and I was up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L.

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital External Hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an added hard drive for my Apple Time Capsule. Why WD? I have owned several external HD's and Western Digital drives have given great service with little or no problems. This one has been in service for about a month and a half and to date there have been no problems. Delivery was prompt and I think the price is excellent for the product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swift

customer_reviews.title: WD My Book Studio Edition-2, 1TB w/ Quad Interface
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of storage available for the same amount as my desktop computer hard drives. Has higher speed connections for faster Windows Backups. Best with two external hard drives for the desktop computer two hard drives being Raided.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Henri Blais

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Mac and Snow Leopard
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what others are complaining about, this drives works wonderfully with my older MacBook running Snow Leopard. It does put itself to sleep, but it spins up quite fast. I'm currently using the drive to store my ever expanding iTunes library, streaming to my Apple TV 2 is flawless. I may pick up another one of these for backup in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: VA Techhead

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and received the My Book Studio II and so far we love it. It was easy enough to plug it in and drag and drop everything we needed to backup.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Great starter backup drive
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for this drive as a backup for my large media collection, I filled it up already, I'm glad that it possible to easily upgrade to larger drives
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pieprzica

customer_reviews.title: Solod performer.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it claims. Using it with a 6' eSATA cable on the eSATA port on the minidock on a Dell Latitude E4310. I get read and write performance about 10% faster than the OEM internal hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cole

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This HD lasted only one year. The replacement only lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pond

product_meta.title: WD My Book Studio II - 2 TB (2 x 1 TB) USB 2.0/FireWire 800/eSATA Desktop External Hard Drive
product_meta.description: Capacity:2 TBWD's My Book Studio Edition II dual-drive, quad-interface external storage system for Mac offers optimum performance for creative professionals. Lightning-fast FireWire 800 or eSATA interfaces combined with RAID 0 (striping) yields the speed you need for fast, smooth video and audio editing, rendering complex 3D objects or special effects, and saving huge blocks of data in record time. Set the system to RAID 1 (mirroring) for the peace of mind in knowing that if one drive in this two-drive system ever fails, the system continues to run and your data is safe. Includes automatic data backup software, user-serviceability, a 5-year limited warranty, and works with Apple's Time Machine.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars454 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
